title: MagellanNTK user manual
text: MagellanNTK highly configurable workflow manager offers qualitative workflow manager follows simple robust strategy. allows work data MultiAssayExperiment format well data derived (e.g., QFeatures). result, can process analyze experimental data wide variety disciplines. MagellanNTK uses data structure provided MultiAssayExperiment package, allows experimental data resulting series processes stored. results various data processing operations added current dataset single result file contains information entire analysis. pipelines used MagellanNTK plugins form Shiny modules, whose code stored directory specific pipeline. plugins added MagellanNTK application launched. structure directories described document ‘Inside MagellanNTK’. MagellanNTK can run either complete pipeline (processes) single process. latter option useful developing new process faster, targeted data handling. One key features MagellanNTK high degree customization. achieve , Shiny modules extensively used simplify implementation. “Generic functions” MagellanNTK functions can come MagellanNTK (default), plugins containing pipelines, packages. choice functions specified configuration file (named config.txt) plugin. example plugin provided MagellanNTK, see functions point MagellanNTK functions (default value).

MagellanNTK, process defined data analysis process performs minimal consistent set operations (called ‘steps’) dataset. process input object returns object output. Actually, four tags refines possibilities step: Mandatory: indicates whether task must executed able continue workflow. Done-Validated/Undone: indicates whether step executed validated. final step (‘Save’) process validated, MAE dataset returned additional SE compared input. features MagellanTK UI (Exploratory Data Analyzer, ‘Save ’) updated new dataset. Skipped: indicates whether task skipped (.e. validated least one step validated). possible non-mandatory steps. Enabled/disabled: indicates whether task executable (UI enabled disabled). time step validated, new SE added dataset. new dataset used input following steps.

what: First sight of the user interface
title: MagellanNTK user manual
text: MagellanNTK package essentially based shinydashboard package adapted simplify (header control bar right removed). user interface consists two parts: sidebar left main screen. Sidebar left containing general menus. Main part displays workflow manager. Sidebar menu. sidebar contains main menus. expands mouse hovers retracts otherwise. different menus follows: Home: provides general information MagellanNTK. default, content minimal. Dataset: Open file: allows select dataset work . import: allows convert results file format compatible MagellanNTK. Save : displays module called download_dataset, allows export current dataset. native MagellanNTK module allows exporting .rdata format. module one configurable modules. Workflow: Run: displays data manager interface. interface displayed even dataset, point, widgets disabled. enabled according logic implemented manager. FAQ: opens Rmd file FAQ current pipeline. file must stored md directory within folder pipeline. Manual: displays user manual current pipeline. Release notes: displays release notes file current pipeline. Main screen interfaces linked menu items displayed main screen. Specifically, data manager displayed main section. details provided later document. display visible click Workflow/Run sidebar menu. stage document, dataset loaded yet, workflow interfaces disabled. However, user can still navigate pipeline discover various processes parameters available. user interface provided MagellanNTK allows work processes pipelines well. Thus, interfaces processes pipelines similar share lot features. reason, section mainly focuses process workflow. Describing complex structures easier.

title: MagellanNTK user manual
text: Plugins (processes) MagellanNTK directly installed package. Plugin files located special directory (see document ‘Inside MagellanNTK’) can stored elsewhere: can user’s computer, another R package. use given plugin MagellanNTK, access path must specified via parameter MagellanNTK() function. greater ease use, possible create specific R script run given plugin. following code, contents file called ‘PipelineDemo_Preprocessing.R’ launches MagellanNTK ‘Preprocessing’ module contained ‘PipelineDemo’ demonstration plugin (pipeline). First, launch application using following commands: open new tab default web browser. default UI MagellanNTK quite empty. first action perform load dataset. can done clicking menu “Dataset” -> “Open file”. haven’t exported dataset MagellanNTK yet, select “demo datasets” option choose one datasets included MagellanNTK package. tutorial, select ‘lldata’ dataset consits one SE containing empty matrix assay. dataset loaded, click menu “Workflow/Run” launch plugin. main screen, interface displayed.
code: library(MagellanNTK) wf.name <- 'PipelineDemo_Preprocessing' wf.path <- system.file('workflow/PipelineDemo', package = 'MagellanNTK') MagellanNTK(wf.path, wf.name)

title: MagellanNTK user manual
text: Three buttons available interact whole current step navigate different steps process: Commands (Previous step, Reset workflow, Next step. Prev changes current step set previous one. button enabled least one step backward, Similarly, Next (right) changes current step set next one timeline. button enabled least one step forwards, Reset sets workflow original state: widgets set default value, current step becomes first one enabled steps become disabled).

title: MagellanNTK user manual
text: ‘PipelineDemo’ example pipeline provided MagellanNTK package. contains three data processing steps: DataGeneration: creates dataset using two Gaussian distributions. Filtering: filter rows based average sum values. Normalization: normalize columns using sum average values column. Clustering: cluster data order identify two Gaussian distributions used generate . Note ‘Description’ ‘Save’ steps strictly speaking data processing steps. description step displays contents file workflow directory allows view information pipeline. last step, ‘Save’, allows directly access module downloading processed dataset (went “Save ” sidebar). ‘PipelineDemo’ can launch typing following command R console:
code: library(MagellanNTK) wf.name <- 'PipelineDemo' wf.path <- system.file('workflow/PipelineDemo', package = 'MagellanNTK') MagellanNTK(wf.path, wf.name)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Samuel Wieczorek. Maintainer, author. Thomas Burger. Author. Manon Gaudin. Author.

title: A customizable Workflow Manager
text: Le package MagellanNTK est un moteur de gestion de workflows qui permet d’exécuter une série de process d’analyses sur des jeux de données. Il contient des fonctions génériques d’entrée/sortie de dataset qui sont adaptées à des formats de données de type list. Pour utiliser les fonctionnalités de MagellanNTK, il est nécessaire d’utiliser des workflows soit enregistrés sur l’ordinateur, soit disponibles dans un package La principale puissance de ce package est que ces fonctions natives sont entièrement configurableS. MagellanNTK offre une gestion de workflow

title: A customizable Workflow Manager
text: can install development version MagellanNTK GitHub :

title: A customizable Workflow Manager
text: MagellanNTK R package proposes framework navigate steps complex data processing tool succession processes mostly chronological. example, process composed three steps, easy run first steps, second finally last one. like dataflow manager. Moreover, navigation system, core MagellanNTK, can used several levels. can possible define, example, super-process (.e. pipeline) step whole process containing several steps.

title: A customizable Workflow Manager
text: Launching pipeline Launching single process following example, lance MAgellan avec seulement le process ‘ProcessA’.
code: library(MagellanNTK) path <- system.file('workflow/PipelineDemo', package = 'MagellanNTK') shiny::runApp(workflowApp("PipelineDemo_Process1", path, dataIn = lldata)) library(MagellanNTK) wf.name <- 'PipelineDemo_ProcessA' wf.path <- system.file('workflow/PipelineDemo', package = 'MagellanNTK') MagellanNTK(wf.path, wf.name)

Thus, first item mandatory vector TRUE. continued... ## Initialization  ### Generic process generic process  * Generic pipeline : xxxx  * Description pipeline: case process called 'Description'  first process module pipeline Wrapper function constructor class

title: Config class definition — Config-class
code: Config(   fullname = "",   mode = "",   steps = NULL,   mandatory = NULL,   steps.source.file = NULL )  # S4 method for class 'Config' initialize(.Object, fullname, mode, steps, mandatory, steps.source.file)  Config(   fullname = "",   mode = "",   steps = NULL,   mandatory = NULL,   steps.source.file = NULL )

title: Config class definition — Config-class
text: fullname complete name pipeline process (case, concatenation name pipeline name process , separated '_') mode `character()` indicates whether current module used 'process' 'pipeline.' Default value NULL steps vector containing names steps process pipeline. mandatory vector boolean element indicates whether corresponding steps mandatory . length vector steps. steps.source.file `vector` item source code corresponding step. .Object xxx

title: Config class definition — Config-class
text: fullname name process concatenation name pipeline name process , separated '_'. name name process pipeline. parent name pipeline/process owns instance mode `character()` indicates configuration whole process process pipeline. steps `vector` `character()` contains primary steps pipeline. Two steps automatically inserted vector: 'Description 'first position 'Save' end. mandatory `vector` `boolean()` item necessary code GUI step. size vector number  steps ll.UI `vector` Shiny source code. item necessary code GUI step. size vector number steps steps.source.file `vector` item source code corresponding step. steps `vector` `character()` contains primary steps pipeline. Two steps automatically inserted vector: 'Description 'first position 'Save' end. mandatory `vector` `boolean()` item necessary code GUI step. size vector number  steps

title: Config class definition — Config-class
code: # Example of a generic process generic.proc <- Config(     fullname = "PipelineDemo_Process1",     mode = "process",     steps = c("Step 1", "Step 2"),     mandatory = c(TRUE, FALSE) )   # Example of a generic pipeline generic.pipe <- Config(     fullname = "Pipe1_PipelineDemo",     mode = "pipeline",     steps = c("Process 1", "Process 2"),     mandatory = c(TRUE, FALSE) )  # Example of a root pipeline (process has no parent) root.pipe <- Config(     mode = "pipeline",     fullname = "PipelineDemo",     steps = c("Process1", "Process2 bis", "Process3"),     mandatory = c(FALSE, FALSE, TRUE) )   # Example of a description module (process has no steps) description.process <- Config(     fullname = "PipelineDemo_Description",     mode = "process",     steps = "",     mandatory = "" )   generic.proc #> 	 ------- Config ------- #> 	fullname: PipelineDemo_Process1 #> 	name: Process1 #> 	parent: PipelineDemo #> 	mode: process #> 	names(steps): Description Step1 Step2 Save #> 	steps: Description Step 1 Step 2 Save #> 	mandatory: TRUE TRUE FALSE TRUE #> 	names(ll.UI):  #> 	ll.UI:  #>  generic.pipe #> 	 ------- Config ------- #> 	fullname: Pipe1_PipelineDemo #> 	name: PipelineDemo #> 	parent: Pipe1 #> 	mode: pipeline #> 	names(steps): Description Process1 Process2 Save #> 	steps: Description Process 1 Process 2 Save #> 	mandatory: TRUE TRUE FALSE TRUE #> 	names(ll.UI):  #> 	ll.UI:  #>  root.pipe #> 	 ------- Config ------- #> 	fullname: PipelineDemo #> 	name: PipelineDemo #> 	parent:  #> 	mode: pipeline #> 	names(steps): Description Process1 Process2bis Process3 Save #> 	steps: Description Process1 Process2 bis Process3 Save #> 	mandatory: TRUE FALSE FALSE TRUE TRUE #> 	names(ll.UI):  #> 	ll.UI:  #>  description.process #> 	 ------- Config ------- #> 	fullname: PipelineDemo_Description #> 	name: Description #> 	parent: PipelineDemo #> 	mode: process #> 	names(steps):  #> 	steps:  #> 	mandatory:  #> 	names(ll.UI):  #> 	ll.UI:  #>

title: Datasets processing — dataset-processing
text: manual page describes manipulation methods using [list] objects. index name `` can specified define array (name index) operate. following functions currently available: - `keepDatasets(object, range)` keep datasets object range - `addDatasets(object, dataset, name)` add 'dataset' object (type list) - `Save(object, file)` stores object .RData file function appends dataset list customization necessary function deletes items included range parameter manual page describes manipulation methods using [list] objects. index name `` can specified define array (name index) operate. following functions currently available: - `keepDatasets(object, range)` keep datasets object range - `addDatasets(object, dataset, name)` add 'dataset' object (type list) - `Save(object, file)` stores object .RData file

code: if (interactive()) {     obj <- assay(lldata[[1]])     shiny::runApp(format_DT(obj))     #     # Compute style from within third party tab     #     obj <- as.data.frame(matrix(1:30, byrow = TRUE, nrow = 6))     colnames(obj) <- paste0("col", 1:5)      mask <- as.data.frame(matrix(rep(LETTERS[1:5], 6), byrow = TRUE, nrow = 6))       style <- list(         cols = colnames(obj),         vals = colnames(mask),         unique = unique(mask),         pal = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(5, "Dark2")[1:5]     )      shiny::runApp(format_DT(obj,         hidden = mask,         hc_style = style     )) }

text: function generates necessary code modify variable 'config' (slots steps mandatory). adds 'Description' step TRUE value beginning 'steps' 'mandatory'  list, erases white spaces names steps. function generates necessary code modify variable 'config' (slots steps mandatory). adds 'Description' step TRUE value beginning 'steps' 'mandatory'  list, erases white spaces names steps. function create source code needed inside module declare reactive variable called 'widgets.default.values'. # Declaration variables contain values widgets avoid confusion, first string name step second name widget function create source code needed inside module declare reactive variable called 'rv.custom.default.values'. # Declaration variables contain values user variables. avoid confusion, first string name step second name widget Returned value process function generates dynamically observeEvent function widget

title: Predefined modal — mod_modalDialog
code: if (interactive()) {  ######################################################## ## # Example with a simple static HTML ## ########################################################  shiny::runApp(mod_modalDialog(title = "test modalDialog", uiContent = p("test")))  ######################################################## ## ##   Example with a simple Shiny module without any return value ## ########################################################  simple_mod_ui <- function(id) {     # create the namespace from the id     ns <- NS(id)     fluidPage(         actionButton(ns("test"), "Test")     ) }   simple_mod_server <- function(id) { # height auto      moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {         ns <- session$ns          # reactiveValues object for storing current data set.         dataOut <- reactiveVal(NULL)          observeEvent(input$test, {             dataOut(paste0("Clicked ", input$test, " times."))         })           return(reactive({             dataOut()         }))     }) }   shiny::runApp(mod_modalDialog(title = "test modalDialog", uiContent = p("test")))   ######################################################## ## ## Example with a more complex Shiny module with a return value ## ########################################################  funcs <- list(     open_dataset = "MagellanNTK::open_dataset",     open_demoDataset = "MagellanNTK::open_demoDataset",     infos_dataset = "MagellanNTK::infos_dataset",     donwload_dataset = "MagellanNTK::download_dataset",     addDatasets = "MagellanNTK::addDatasets",     keepDatasets = "MagellanNTK::keepDatasets" )   shiny::runApp(     mod_modalDialog(         title = "test modalDialog",         external_mod = "mod_load_package",         external_mod_args = list(funcs = funcs)     ) ) }

text: list containing following items: value <- list( * funcs = tmp, * verbose = get_data(lines, "verbose") == "enabled", * UI_view_debugger: `boolean` show (TRUE) hide (FALSE) debugger interface * UI_view_open_pipeline: `boolean` show (TRUE) hide (FALSE) UI open pipeline * UI_view_convert_dataset `boolean` show (TRUE) hide (FALSE) UI convert/import dataset * UI_view_change_Look_Feel `boolean` show (TRUE) hide (FALSE) UI change L&F * UI_view_change_core_funcs `boolean` show (TRUE) hide (FALSE) UI change generic functions * extension `character()` specifies extension file allowed processed pipeline, * class `character()` specifies class dataset processed pipeline, * package  `character()` specifies package owns pipeline * demo_package xxx * URL_manual xxx * URL_ReleaseNotes xxx

title: Shiny example module `Process` — workflow
code: pipe_workflow_ui(id)  pipe_workflow_server(   id,   path = NULL,   dataIn = reactive({      NULL  }),   usermod = "user",   verbose = FALSE )  pipe_workflowApp(   id,   path = NULL,   dataIn = NULL,   usermod = "user",   verbose = FALSE )  proc_workflow_ui(id)  proc_workflow_server(   id,   path = NULL,   dataIn = reactive({      NULL  }),   usermod = "user",   verbose = FALSE )  proc_workflowApp(   id,   path = NULL,   dataIn = NULL,   usermod = "user",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Shiny example module `Process` — workflow
text: id `character()` id Shiny module path `character()` path directory contains files directories pipeline. dataIn xxx usermod character specifies running mode MagellanNTK. * user (default) : xxx * dev: xxx verbose `boolean` indicate whether turn (FALSE) (TRUE) verbose mode logs.

title: Shiny example module `Process` — workflow
code: if (interactive()) {     library(MagellanNTK)     library(shiny)     path <- system.file("workflow/PipelineDemo", package = "MagellanNTK")     files <- list.files(file.path(path, "R"), full.names = TRUE)     for (f in files) {         source(f, local = FALSE, chdir = TRUE)     }       # Nothing happens when dataIn is NULL     pipe_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", path, dataIn = NULL)      pipe_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", path, dataIn = lldata)      pipe_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", dataIn = data.frame())      pipe_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", path, dataIn = lldata)      pipe_workflowApp("PipelineB", path, tl.layout = c("v", "h"))      pipe_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", path,         dataIn = lldata,         tl.layout = c("v", "h")     )       # Nothing happens when dataIn is NULL     proc_workflowApp("PipelineDemo_Process1", path, dataIn = NULL)      proc_workflowApp("PipelineDemo_Process1", path, dataIn = lldata)      proc_workflowApp("PipelineDemo_Process1", path, dataIn = data.frame(), tl.layout = "v")      proc_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", path, dataIn = lldata, tl.layout = c("v", "h"))      proc_workflowApp("PipelineDemo", path, dataIn = lldata, tl.layout = c("v", "h")) }
